Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the extent of preexisting immunity to COVID-19, suggesting that about a third of the public has cross-reactivity, which is not supported by scientific evidence.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks sufficient scientific evidence to support the assertion of preexisting immunity to COVID-19 through cross-reactivity.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that preexisting immunity through cross-reactivity would contribute to herd immunity, which scientists argue is not the case.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim contradicts the findings of studies that suggest cross-reactive antibodies that can prevent infection with the coronavirus are not widespread in the population.
